VSCM 100.courseDesc: This course explores current potentials, limitations, and issues related to use of computer software for design applications. Projects include graphics creation and manipulation; image acquisition, creation and manipulation; text creation and manipulation; typography; input and output options and control; hardware/software/system fundamentals; and troubleshooting.
VSCM 100.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 140.courseDesc: Covers the skills and understanding of letterforms as geometry and type, development of hand/eye skill in letter-forming, investigation of solids and voids, and use of traditional and modern tools and materials. Studio.
VSCM 140.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 200.courseDesc: Provides continued study of electronic imaging with emphasis on Graphic Design process for print and screen design.
VSCM 200.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 220.courseDesc: This course focuses on the concepts, issues and techniques related to the design of Websites. Emphasis is on the design and hierarchy of a website. Students will utilize HTML, XHTML, basic JavaScript, dynamic HTML, and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) skills.
VSCM 220.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 221.courseDesc: ContinuesVSCM 220. Increases the complexity and scope of the art direction and design for web graphics. Students will focus on professional quality web pages using dedicated software that adheres to current industry standards.
VSCM 221.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 221.prereqs: VSCM 220 [Min Grade D] or WMGD 220 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 222.courseDesc: ContinuesVSCM 221and increases the complexity and scope of the art direction and design for web graphics. Students will focus on professional quality web pages using dedicated software that adheres to current industry standards.
VSCM 222.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 222.prereqs: (VSCM 221 [Min Grade D] or WMGD 330 [Min Grade D]) and VSCM 231 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 230.courseDesc: Provides an overview of graphic design as an applied art. Covers the given, the formal, and the psychological aspects of graphic design.
VSCM 230.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 230.prereqs: VSST 102 [Min Grade D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade D] or VSST 100 [Min Grade D] or VSST 107 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 231.courseDesc: ContinuesVSCM 230. Covers corporate identity and explores logo development using the pictoral mark, typographic solution, and abstract interpretation as symbols of identity.
VSCM 231.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 232.courseDesc: Examines problems in graphic design on the relationship between designer and client, including solving specific situations of image-making with emphasis on the total identity of an organization, firm, or publication. Involves extensive exploration of color and imagery. Studio.
VSCM 232.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 240.courseDesc: Uses the history of type as the backdrop for the introduction to the art and craft of conventional through state-of-the-art typesetting as well as the creative and extraordinary use of type. Focuses on the letter, word, and sentence. Studio/lecture.
VSCM 240.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 240.prereqs: VSST 102 [Min Grade D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade D] or VSST 107 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 241.courseDesc: Covers traditional and electronic means of print production. Explores alternate means of production and various printing and output methods. Studio.
VSCM 241.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 242.courseDesc: ContinuesVSCM 240. Broadens the scope to deal with the paragraph and the typeset page, with increased attention to the importance of subtleties and refinements. Explores the differing requirements of type in relationship to pictorial images.
VSCM 242.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 247.courseDesc: This course develops a visual sensitivity to typographical compositions on screen while expanding knowledge of current technologies.
VSCM 247.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 322.courseDesc: This course focuses on the concepts, issues and techniques related to the design of Websites. Emphasis is on the design and hierarchy of a website. Students will utilize HTML, XHTML, basic JavaScript, dynamic HTML, and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) skills.
VSCM 322.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 322.prereqs: VSCM 221 [Min Grade D] or WMGD 330 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 332.courseDesc: This course focuses on techniques and methods of advanced problem solving and exploration of extended identity systems. Students learn to analyze conceptual and contextual relationships pertinent to any visual communication assignment.
VSCM 332.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 332.prereqs: VSCM 232 [Min Grade D] and VSCM 222 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 333.courseDesc: This course focuses on information graphics, including signage, environmental graphic design, and exhibit design. Information graphics are graphic visual representations of information, data or knowledge. These graphics present complex information quickly and clearly. Studio.
VSCM 333.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 333.prereqs: VSCM 332 [Min Grade D] or VSCM 331 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 340.courseDesc: Typography III concentrates on the exploration and management of large blocks of text in specific design problems. Special emphasis will be placed on the style and readability of typographic treatments.
VSCM 340.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 345.courseDesc: The 12-day program is open to all University students and entails a collaboration between Drexel students and Tamagawa students in Japan as well as at Drexel (Philadelphia). In Japan, students will survey and experience the true Japan by visiting exceptional sites that exemplify the old and the new world of Japanese culture and life. The trip will balance visits between the everyday/industries and cultural sites/museums to capture a comprehensive understanding of the Japanese “IKI.” In Philadelphia, each group (made of Tamagawa and Drexel students) will conduct on-site research in historical and cultural venues and neighborhoods. Students will learn about immigration history, changing cultures over generations, and the challenges that diverse communities face.
VSCM 345.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 350.courseDesc: Concentrates on impact and significance of the graphic design profession in society through the history and movements of the profession and the work of 20th-century masters of visual communication. Students will analyze conceptual and contextual relationships and develop greater awareness of stylistic content and its relevance to the culture.
VSCM 350.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 360.courseDesc: Weekly visits to studios of various design disciplines such as small graphic design offices, environmental graphic design firms, advertising agencies, book and magazine publishers, and website developers. A written report is due at the end of the term.
VSCM 360.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 370.courseDesc: This course concentrates on exploring alternative formats and unique delivery systems for the transfer of information. Special emphasis is placed on developing appropriate imagery for the defined readership, formatting, the use of a comprehensive grid system and the development of a wayfinding system for the publication. The course will build a greater awareness of proportion, readability and information transfer, and will reinforce the use of color as a visual communication tool.
VSCM 370.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 370.prereqs: VSCM 232 [Min Grade D] and VSCM 242 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 430.courseDesc: ContinuesVSCM 333. Explores three-dimensional graphic design processes and techniques for communication, including problems of scale, material, form, and function. Emphasizes package design. Includes point-of-purchase design. Studio.
VSCM 430.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 430.prereqs: VSCM 322 [Min Grade D] and VSCM 333 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 440.courseDesc: Investigates design of books, from their pre-Gutenberg origins to contemporary technology of design, binding, paper, and finishing. Includes multiple page formats, production grids, and sequential images. Lecture/studio.
VSCM 440.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 440.prereqs: VSCM 322 [Min Grade D] and VSCM 333 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 450.courseDesc: Focuses on the preparation of a professional Graphic Design portfolio. A critical process that includes the screening of completed projects, reworking or expanding projects, and reconstructing/creating final portfolio components. A formal interview presentation of the portfolio is also explored and refined.
VSCM 450.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 450.prereqs: VSCM 430 [Min Grade D] or ADGD 320 [Min Grade D] or EVGD 320 [Min Grade D]

VSCM 460.courseDesc: Covers running a design office, including basic contracts, fee structures, and the design process. Explores types of design offices; working with suppliers, printers, photographers, and illustrators; scheduling; resumes and portfolios; taxes; and marketing of graphic design services. Lecture/field work.
VSCM 460.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 478.courseDesc: An exploration for the subtleties that distinguish excellence in graphic design print, web and motion venues. Selections include: Advanced Typography and Electronic Portfolio.
VSCM 478.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 478.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 9 credits

VSCM 479.courseDesc: An exploration of advanced media development in Graphic Design as relevancy and currency demands. Selections include: Illustration I and II and Bookmaking.
VSCM 479.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 479.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 12 credits

VSCM 485.courseDesc: Development and analysis of the corporate annual report as a graphic design concept and as a developed marketing tool.
VSCM 485.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

VSCM 496.courseDesc: Requires each student to define a problem and set a goal and strategies, develop a concept, and carry out a solution. Divides time among research, design, thematic development, and final presentation. Requires instructor approval of study.
VSCM 496.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
VSCM 496.prereqs: VSCM 221 [Min Grade D] and VSCM 322 [Min Grade D] and VSCM 430 [Min Grade D]
